Dear Haitham,

 

Thank you for your email.

 

While we acknowledge the request for an increase in the deductible, we firmly believe it is unwarranted given the favorable loss ratio during the LTA period. Objectively, the policy’s performance during the LTA period is in benefit of GIG, and from our perspective, no adjustments should have been requested.

 

That said, while we cannot agree to the proposed Long-Term Agreement (LTA), we are prepared to make a concession as a gesture of goodwill. In recognition of GIG’s past excellent handling of the Dhahran claim, we are willing to accept an increase in the deductible for the STP policy to SAR 35,000, up from the current SAR 20,000.

 

Please note that this concession is purely a favor on our part and should not be interpreted as something GIG is entitled to. We are offering this solely to maintain good relations based on mutual respect, and in return, we expect GIG to act fairly and in good faith in all future dealings with us.

 

Any further increase beyond this point would significantly diminish the value of the STP policy, whose primary benefit is to mitigate the SAMA deductible. We believe this is a reasonable adjustment and trust that it will be received in the same spirit of partnership and cooperation.

 

We trust that GIG will appreciate this gesture and reciprocate accordingly in future collaborations.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Dear Haitham,

 

Thank you for your email.

 

While we acknowledge the request for an increase in the deductible, we firmly believe it is unwarranted given the favorable loss ratio during the LTA period. Objectively, the policy’s performance during the LTA period is in benefit of GIG, and from our perspective, no adjustments should have been requested.

 

That said, while we cannot agree to the proposed Long-Term Agreement (LTA), we are prepared to make a concession as a gesture of goodwill. In recognition of GIG’s past excellent handling of the Dhahran claim, we are willing to accept an increase in the deductible for the STP policy to SAR 35,000, up from the current SAR 20,000.

 

Please note that this concession is purely a favor on our part and should not be interpreted as something GIG is entitled to. We are offering this solely to maintain good relations based on mutual respect, and in return, we expect GIG to act fairly and in good faith in all future dealings with us.

 

Any further increase beyond this point would significantly diminish the value of the STP policy, whose primary benefit is to mitigate the SAMA deductible. We believe this is a reasonable adjustment and trust that it will be received in the same spirit of partnership and cooperation.

We believe this is a reasonable adjustment and trust that it will be received in the same spirit of partnership and cooperation.

Dear Haitham,

 

Thank you for your email.

 

While we acknowledge the request for an increase in the deductible, we firmly believe it is unwarranted given the favorable loss ratio during the LTA period.

While we acknowledge the request for an increase in the deductible, we firmly believe it is unwarranted given the favorable loss ratio during the LTA period. Objectively, the policy’s performance during the LTA period is in benefit of GIG, and from our perspective, no adjustments should have been requested.

 

That said, while we cannot agree to the proposed Long-Term Agreement (LTA), we are prepared to make a concession as a gesture of goodwill. In recognition of GIG’s past excellent handling of the Dhahran claim, we are willing to accept an increase in the deductible for the STP policy to SAR 35,000, up from the current SAR 20,000.

 

Please note that this concession is purely a favor on our part and should not be interpreted as something GIG is entitled to. We are offering this solely to maintain good relations based on mutual respect, and in return, we expect GIG to act fairly and in good faith in all future dealings with us.

 

Any further increase beyond this point would significantly diminish the value of the STP policy, whose primary benefit is to mitigate the SAMA deductible. We believe this is a reasonable adjustment and trust that it will be received in the same spirit of partnership and cooperation.

 

We trust that GIG will appreciate this gesture and reciprocate accordingly in future collaborations.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop
